intro: Asteromoea incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf asteromoea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, and its flowers are typically blue to violet in color. Asteromoea incisa is often found in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
